intro: Etlingera orbiculata, commonly known as the red ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces striking red or orange flower spikes. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The botanical characteristics of Etlingera orbiculata make it a valuable species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
